Here's a Python code that generates the tables and saves them to an XML file named 'statistics.xml':
```python
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET

# Create root element of the XML file
root = ET.Element('statistics')

# Create tables for recall rate and angle accuracy
recall_table = ET.SubElement(root, 'table', name='recall_rate')
angle_table = ET.SubElement(root, 'table', name='angle_accuracy')

# Define distances and angles
distances = [0, 30, 60, 90, 120, 150, 180]
angles = [0, 15, 30, 45, 60, 75, 90]

# Loop through each distance and angle to add values to the tables
for distance in distances:
    # Create row for the distance in both tables
    recall_row = ET.SubElement(recall_table, 'row', name=str(distance))
    angle_row = ET.SubElement(angle_table, 'row', name=str(distance))
    
    for angle in angles:
        # Extract recall rate and angle accuracy from the text
        text = """
        dist = {}, thres = {}
        0 degree: <45 = 10/10, >45 = 0/10
        15 degree: <45 = 10/10, >45 = 0/10
        30 degree: <45 = 7/10, >45 = 3/10
        45 degree: <45 = 10/10, >45 = 0/10
        60 degree: <45 = 10/10, >45 = 0/10
        75 degree: <45 = 6/10, >45 = 4/10
        90 degree: <45 = 4/10, >45 = 6/10
        fp num = 33/70
        """
        start_index = text.index("{} degree: <45".format(angle))
        end_index = text.index("\n", start_index)
        values = text[start_index:end_index].split("= ")[1].split(", ")
        below_45 = values[0].split("/")
        above_45 = values[1].split("/")
        
        # Calculate recall rate and angle accuracy
        recall_rate = int(below_45[0]) / 10
        if angle < 45:
            angle_accuracy = int(below_45[0]) / int(below_45[1])
        else:
            angle_accuracy = int(above_45[0]) / int(above_45[1])
        
        # Add recall rate and angle accuracy to the tables
        ET.SubElement(recall_row, 'column', name=str(angle)).text = "{:.2f}".format(recall_rate)
        ET.SubElement(angle_row, 'column', name=str(angle)).text = "{:.2f}".format(angle_accuracy)

# Write the XML file
tree = ET.ElementTree(root)
tree.write('statistics.xml')
```
Note: The text in the code above is the same as the sample text provided in the question. To use actual data, replace the `text` variable with the actual text data.
